newsitem.title: USA: Kansas wheat tour pegs 1997 crop at 336.2 million.
newsitem.headline: Kansas wheat tour pegs 1997 crop at 336.2 million.

text.p: The 1997 Kansas wheat crop Thursday was estimated at 336.2 million bushels, according to a Wheat Quality Council tour group.
That compares with 1996 Kansas wheat production of 255.2 million bushels, according to the U.S. Agriculture Department. Last year's crop was hurt by dry weather.
The group pegged the yield per acre at 36.8 bushels, compared with 29.0 bushels per acre in 1996.
The production projection was comprised from estimates from 42 tour participants. The high estimate was 390 million bushels and low was 302.5 million.

The Wheat Quality Council tour group this week scouted Kansas wheat fields and along with uncertainty about the extent of freeze damage in April, concerns surfaced about dry topsoils in western Kansas, tour participants said.
Infestations of Russian leaf aphids in southwest Kansas also could further weaken the crop production potential, the tour group reported.
The five-year tour average estimate for Kansas hard red winter wheat production is 354.2 million bushels.
The U.S. Department of Agriculture is due to issue its first estimate of 1997 U.S. winter wheat production on Monday.
